text: hi my name is Rebecca and in today's

commonly confused words that are used
with the present perfect tense now the
present perfect tense is usually when we
say something like I have been I have
seen you have gone they have been right
that is the present perfect tense the
present perfect tense is used to talk
about something that happened in the
past and is still true or still relevant
now or today so it kind of includes the
past as well as the present all right
but let's look at some examples and see
how to use the word since and for
correctly with this tense okay so since
you should be using with the point in
time the beginning of the point when
something started to be true and for you
should use to describe the length of
time that something was true now that
seems very technical so let's apply it
so you understand more easily okay we
could say let's say let's suppose that
the year is 2010 which it is actually
right now 2010 so I could say I have
worked here since 1990 right or if it's
2010 I have worked here for 20 years
right
you see since plus the point in time the
beginning when that became true and for
plus the actual length of time or period
of time that that statement is true so I
have worked here since nineteen
I have worked here for 20 years
another example we have lived in Mexico
since 2005 or we have lived in Mexico
for five years okay so I hope this helps
you to understand the difference between

make is they sometimes say I have lived
here since twenty years so you can't do
